intro: Sida chaetodonta, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy stems and leaves. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as roadsides and fields. Sida chaetodonta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
